help_text:
For all voxels that are designated as bad, if they neighbor a non-bad voxel with data or are within the specified distance of such a voxel, replace the value in the bad voxel with a value calculated from nearby non-bad voxels that have data, otherwise set the value to zero.  No matter how small <distance> is, dilation will always use at least the face neighbor voxels.

By default, voxels that have data with the value 0 are bad, specify -bad-voxel-roi to only count voxels as bad if they are selected by the roi.  If -data-roi is not specified, all voxels are assumed to have data.

To get the behavior of version 1.3.2 or earlier, use '-legacy-cutoff -exponent 2'.

Valid values for <method> are:

NEAREST - use the value from the nearest good voxel
WEIGHTED - use a weighted average based on distance

options.description: use a different exponent in the weighting function

params.description: exponent 'n' to use in (1 / (distance ^ n)) as the weighting function (default 7)

options.description: specify an roi of voxels to overwrite, rather than voxels with value zero

params.description: volume file, positive values denote voxels to have their values replaced

options.description: specify an roi of where there is data

params.description: volume file, positive values denote voxels that have data

options.description: select a single subvolume to dilate
use the v1.3.2 method of excluding voxels further than the dilation distance when calculating the dilated value
additionally use the gradient to extrapolate, intended to be used with WEIGHTED
apply presmoothing before computing gradient vectors, not recommended

params.description: the size of gaussian smoothing kernel in mm, as sigma by default

options.description: kernel size is FWHM, not sigma
